lay siege to somebody/something.translat: if a group of people lay siege to a place, they try to get control by surrounding it
The armies laid siege to Vienna in 1529.
to do everything you can to get someone to talk to you or notice you
A group of young men were always at the stage door, trying to lay siege to the girls.
if the army or police lay siege to a place, they start a siege against it
In June 1176, King Richard laid siege to Limoges.
if you lay siege to someone, you do everything you can to try and get them to talk to you
Then he set to work laying siege to her with letters.
